block.p: The Federal Reserve cut interest rates for the fourth time in as many months, warning that corporate profits were in trouble. That was confirmed by such companies as Cisco Systems, Hewlett Packard and Honeywell, all of which announced layoffs. But some companies, including General Motors and IBM, had better earnings than expected, and Wall Street found reasons to hope that a recession could be averted. The Nasdaq composite ended its best two weeks ever, rising 26 percent.
